prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a 3D model of a geometric shape composed of multiple interconnected rectangular prisms** We will start by creating a new coordinate system with the following Euler Angles and Translation Vector: * Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.207, 0.0) Now, let's draw a 2D sketch on this coordinate system. We will create three faces, each containing one loop. Each loop will be closed, and will consist of multiple lines: * Face 1: + Loop 1: - Line 1: (0.0, 0.25) to (0.25, 0.25) - Line 2: (0.25, 0.25) to (0.25, 0.5) - Line 3: (0.25, 0.5) to (0.0, 0.5) - Line 4: (0.0, 0.5) to (0.0, 0.25) * Face 2: + Loop 1: - Line 1: (0.25, 0.0) to (0.5, 0.0) - Line 2: (0.5, 0.0) to (0.5, 0.25) - Line 3: (0.5, 0.25) to (0.25, 0.25) - Line 4: (0.25, 0.25) to (0.25, 0.0) * Face 3: + Loop 1: - Line 1: (0.25, 0.5) to (0.5, 0.5) - Line 2: (0.5, 0.5) to (0.5, 0.75) - Line 3: (0.5, 0.75) to (0.25, 0.75) - Line 4: (0.25, 0.75) to (0.25, 0.5) Now, we will scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Next, we will transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Finally, we will extrude the 3D sketch to generate the final 3D model. The extrusion depth will be towards the normal by a factor of 0.207. The length, width, and height of this 3D model are 0.75, 0.21, and 0.75 units respectively. Note: The coordinate system, sketch, scaling, transformation, and extrusion are all part of the same process and should be done as a single operation. Also, the boolean operation specified in the JSON is a "NewBodyFeatureOperation" which essentially means adding this 3D model as a separate solid body.</description>
